verbose_text: It includes corticotrophin releasing hormone (CRH) release from the paraventricular nucleus (PVN) of the hypothalamus into the hypophyseal-portal circulation, stimulating the anterior pituitary gland to release adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and ultimately glucocorticoids from the adrenal cortex.
evidence: corticotrophin-releasing hormone (CRH) release from the paraventricular nucleus (PVN) of the hypothalamus into the hypophyseal-portal circulation, stimulating the anterior pituitary gland to release adrenocorticotropic hormone
